item.title: Heather add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Heather add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Heather add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Heather add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig." -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: Heather add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded. It's a relationship between equals. Only when we know our own darkness well can we be present with the darkness of others. Compassion becomes real when we recognize our shared humanity." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Heather add a quote by Ping Fu
item.description: "Life has been messy for me, as it has for most everyone. I have come to the realization that challenging experiences break us all at some point—our bodies and minds, our hearts and egos. When we put ourselves back together, we find that we are no longer perfectly straight, but rather bent and cracked. Yet it is through these cracks that our authenticity shines. It is by revealing these cracks that we can learn to see and be seen deeply." -- Ping Fu

item.title: Heather add a quote by Miles Kington
item.description: "Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit, wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad." -- Miles Kington

item.title: Heather add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The really important kind of freedom involves attention, and awareness, and discipline, and effort, and being able truly to care about other people and to sacrifice for them, over and over, in myriad petty little unsexy ways, every day." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Heather add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "I don't feel that it is necessary to know exactly what I am. The main interest in life and work is to become someone else that you were not in the beginning." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Heather add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Heather add a quote by Maggie Kuhn
item.description: "Speak your mind even if your voice shakes." -- Maggie Kuhn

item.title: Heather add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Heather add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Heather add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Adults follow paths. Children explore. Adults are content to walk the same way, hundreds of times, or thousands; perhaps it never occurs to adults to step off the paths, to creep beneath rhododendrons, to find the spaces between fences. I was a child, which meant that I knew a dozen different ways of getting out of our property and into the lane, ways that would not involve walking down our drive." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you trust in yourself. . .and believe in your dreams. . .and follow your star. . . you'll still get beaten by people who spent their time working hard and learning things and weren't so lazy." -- Terry Pratchett
